definition: to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff

sentences.english: Cheat death Hou Debiao and liu three also slipped.
sentences.chinese: 诈死的侯德标和刘三也溜了。

definition: to beat sb at their own game (idiom)
lit. the plum tree withers in place of the peach tree/to substitute one thing for another/to carry the can for sb
lit. the cicada sheds its carapace (idiom); fig. to vanish leaving an empty shell/a crafty escape plan
to cross the sea by a trick (idiom)/to achieve one's aim by underhanded means
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
to fall into a trap/taken in by a stratagem/cheated/ripped off
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to impute/to shift the blame onto someone else
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
